ENGLISH SENTENCE WITH CLOZE: The release p{{eriod}} is being adjusted.

JAPANESE SENTENCE: スケジュールは未確定です。

ENGLISH SENTENCE: The schedule hasn't been decided yet.
ENGLISH SENTENCE WITH CLOZE: The schedule hasn't been d{{ecided}} yet.

JAPANESE WORD WITH KANA: 不足(ふそく) ※コミュニーケーション不足(ぶそく)
JAPANESE SENTENCE: チーム内のコミュニケーション不足が、問題になっています。

ENGLISH SENTENCE: The lack of communication among team members is becoming a problem.
ENGLISH SENTENCE WITH CLOZE: The l{{ack}} of communication among team members is becoming a problem.

JAPANESE SENTENCE: 今月は、リリースが多くて、みんな余裕があんまりない。

ENGLISH SENTENCE: We don't have time to spare since we have a lot of releases this month.
ENGLISH SENTENCE WITH CLOZE: We don't have time to s{{pare}} since we have a lot of releases this month.

JAPANESE SENTENCE: システムが正常に動いてないので、今日中に鈴木さんが確認する予定になっています。
JAPANESE SENTENCE WITH KANA: システムが正常(せいじょう)に動(うご)いてないので、今日中(きょうじゅう)に鈴木(すずき)さんが確認(かくにん)する予定(よてい)になっています。
ENGLISH SENTENCE: Since the system isn't working normally, Suzuki-san is going to check on it today.
ENGLISH SENTENCE WITH CLOZE: Since the system isn't working n{{ormally}}, Suzuki-san is going to check on it today.

JAPANESE SENTENCE: これはリリースが来週なので、最優先で進めたほうがいいと思います。
JAPANESE SENTENCE WITH KANA: これはリリースが来週(らいしゅう)なので、最優先(さいゆうせん)で進(すす)めたほうがいいと思います。

ENGLISH SENTENCE WITH CLOZE: I think it's better to make this the t{{op}} p{{riority}} because the release is next week.

ENGLISH SENTENCE WITH CLOZE: Please talk to your manager d{{irectly}} if you have any problems.
